page.title: 04Brittons,Kingswood Factory
page.content: The shoe factory of{G. B. BRITTON Ltd was opened in 1878.It made{boots}for working{miners.}Since then it has turned world wide.It has over{800 working people.The factory covers 4 acres.Its first name was{Bryant and {Britton.}The leather was then stitched by hand but now it is done by machine.They used to make{110,000 pairs but now they make only{40,000 pairs a week.G. B. Britton is the second biggest shoe making factory in the country.To get the shoe into shape they have to use a special piece of plastic.In World War Two the factory was transformed into a place where {Beaufighter}wings were repaired.Their trade name is{GLUV & TUF.}They supply combat boots to the{Army & Navy.
